did.langmaterial: Manuscript (palm-leaf bundle; single-text manuscript) in Tamil
did.unitdate: No internal date. Before 1855, as it is part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1869). Ca. 1835 according to Vinson (1867-1868, p. 1), Cabaton (1912, p. 54). The reason for this date is unknown.

physdesc.physfacet: Palm-leaf. Very good state of preservation, in spite of bore holes caused by insects.
Woodcovers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

scopecontent.p: [[PRESENTATION of the text]] The Attuvaitāṉupavam, “Experience of Non-Duality” (Sanskrit advaita + anubhava), is a philosophical text, of which there seems to exist no printed edition yet. According to the preface (f76) and the final colophon (f95), the author is Rāmakavi, disciple of Civarāmakavi (Sanskrit Śivarāmakavi), himself disciple of Navamakāleṭcumi Nāraciṅkatēcikar (Sanskrit Navamahālakṣmī Nārasiṃhadeśika). In the present manuscript the work consists of 128 stanzas.

[[other MSS testimonies]] Other manuscript testimonies of this text are kept in the GOML (Kuppuswami Sastri 1927: 1240–2, D. 1428–1430; Fazlullah and Chandrasekharan 1949: 2228, R. 1342; Chandrasekharan 1951: No. 106).
The bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two woodcovers:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1.
U2: 21 folios, two parallel Tamil foliations 2‒20 (f1 not explicitly foliated) and 76‒95 = text (mūlam). 8 to 10 lines per page (most often 9), by hand n° 2.
OR: 32 folios, Tamil foliation 2‒32 (f1 not explicitly foliated).
OR: 163 folios, parallel Tamil foliation 1–163 and Arabic foliation 1–163.
OR (in case the title-page is on the front woodcover):
The palm-leaf bundle, a multiple-text manuscript, contains, on the front woodcover:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1. With shelfmark: C/62.
It contains, between the two woodcovers:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1.
U2: 21 folios two parallel Tamil foliations 2‒20 (f1 not explicitly foliated) and 76‒95 = text (mūlam). 8 to 10 lines per page (most often 9), by hand n° 2.
The text is complete/incomplete.

Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, title-page, invocation page, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statements, pratīkas, colophon, table of contents/total stanzas, addendum, etc.

(f[1]r, c2, 1‒2) Attuvaitānupavam [i.e. attuvaitāṉupavam]

U2, folio 75, recto = invocation: marginal title, invocatory stanza, benediction.

U2, folio 77, recto = incipit of Atikāralaṭcaṇam: marginal chapter header, stanza n° 1 of Atikāralaṭcaṇam.

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Lacuna of unknown extent: [...]. Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".

acqinfo.p: Bequest of Edouard Ariel. Made first to Société Asiatique de Paris in 1855, later transfered to Bibliothèque Nationale (see Rosny 1869).
